data.title: Gallagher off to transport in mini reshuffle
data.meta_description: Sile de Valera, the junior education minister who is retiring at the next election, says she has no intention of resigning her post to allow a reshuffle to take place. The Clare TD said she was
data.text:
Sile de Valera, the junior education minister who is retiring at the next election, says she has no intention of resigning her post to allow a reshuffle to take place.

The Clare TD said she was encouraged by the taoiseach in November to keep up her work until the 2007 election, and nobody had approached her since to raise the suggestion of her resigning.

Sean Haughey, son of the former taoiseach, remains favourite for promotion from the backbenches to fill the vacancy left by Callely, but in a different department. His closest rival for promotion is Jim Glennon of Dublin North.

Gallagher would continue to have responsibility for ports, regional harbours and maritime safety, functions passed from the marine department to transport on January 1.
